us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class Line3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.Line3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Line3DBasics, Line3DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<Line3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<Line3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<Line3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<Line3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable

    public class Line3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements Line3DBasics, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<Line3D>
    Represents an infinitely long 3D line defined by a 3D point and a 3D unitary vector.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line3D()
      Default constructor that initializes both point and direction to zero.
      Line3D(double pointOnLineX, double pointOnLineY, double pointOnLineZ, double lineDirectionX, double lineDirectionY, double lineDirectionZ)
      Initializes this line to be passing through the given point, with the vector as the direction.
      Line3D(Line2DReadOnly line2DReadOnly)
      Creates a new line 3D and initializes it to other.
      Line3D(Line3DReadOnly other)
      Creates a new line 3D and initializes it to other.
      Line3D(LineSegment2DReadOnly lineSegment2DReadOnly)
      Creates a new line and initializes it to go through the endpoints of the given line segment.
      Line3D(LineSegment3DReadOnly lineSegment3DReadOnly)
      Creates a new line and initializes it to go through the endpoints of the given line segment.
      Line3D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly firstPointOnLine, us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly secondPointOnLine)
      Initializes this line to be passing through the two given points.
      Line3D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DReadOnly pointOnLine, us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Vector3DReadOnly lineDirection)
      Initializes this line to be passing through the given point, with the vector as the direction.

        public Line3D(double pointOnLineX,
              double pointOnLineY,
              double pointOnLineZ,
              double lineDirectionX,
              double lineDirectionY,
              double lineDirectionZ)
        Initializes this line to be passing through the given point, with the vector as the direction.
        Parameters:
        pointOnLineX - the x-coordinate of a point on this line.
        pointOnLineY - the y-coordinate of a point on this line.
        pointOnLineZ - the z-coordinate of a point on this line.
        lineDirectionX - the x-component of the direction of this line.
        lineDirectionY - the y-component of the direction of this line.
        lineDirectionZ - the z-component of the direction of this line.

      • epsilonEquals

        public boolean epsilonEquals(Line3D other,
                             double epsilon)
        Tests on a per-component basis on the point and vector if this line is equal to other with the tolerance epsilon. This method will return false if the two lines are physically the same but either the point or vector of each line is different. For instance, if this.point == other.point and this.direction == - other.direction, the two lines are physically the same but this method returns false.
        Specified by:
        epsilonEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<Line3D>
        Parameters:
        other - the query. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines are equal, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(Line3D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two lines are geometrically similar.

        Two lines are considered geometrically equal is they are collinear, pointing toward the same or opposite direction.

        Specified by:
        geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<Line3D>
        Parameters:
        other - the line to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two lines represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
